content: of row 39 change to light pink at the end of row 52 change to light mint green at the end of row 65 change to seafoam green at the end of row 78 change to turquoise at the end of row 91 change to medium blue at the end of row 104 change to royal blue at the end of row 117 change to purple at the end of row 130 change to light purple at the end of row 143 change to light lavender at the end of row 156 fasten_off and weave in all ends after row 169 pattern notes be sure to crochet into that last stitch of each row the chain 2 from the previous row - it can be hard to see and stick your hook into because the chains can be tight count your stitches after the first few row to be sure you didn t miss any if you have only 12 colors instead of 13 crochet 14 row of each color to make a blanket the same size as the one shown here you will need 193 yards of each color if you have only 11 colors crochet 15 row of each color you will need 211 yards of each color if you have only 10 colors crochet 17 row of each color you will need 232 yards of each color if you have only 9 colors crochet 19 row of each color you will need 257 yards of each color if you have only 8 colors crochet 21 row of each color you will need 289 yards of each color if you have only 7 colors crochet 24 row of each color you will need 331 yards of each color if you have only 6 colors crochet 28 row of each color you will need 386 yards of each color if you have only 5 colors crochet 34 row of each color you will need 463 yards of each color if you have only 4 colors crochet 42 row of each color you will need 579 yards of each color if you have only 3 colors crochet 56 row of each color you will need 771 yards of each color to make a double bed-sized blanket with drape over the sides 84 by 90 inches 213 by 229 cm chain 248 to start complete 224 row total 17 row of each of 13 colors you will need 440 yards of each color to make a baby blanket 28 by 28 inches 71 by 71 cm chain 91 to start complete 72 row total 6 row of each of 13 colors you will need only 46 yards of each color pattern tutorial 1 to begin row 1 make a slipknot and place the loop on your hook here s a video showing how to make a slipknot https //www youtube com/watch v=yglqoazenlu 2 now make your first chain to do this grab the yarn with your hook also called yarn over
